Entries.default:
The entity collapses in a pile of wrinkled flesh and gaping maws, expiring with an expulsion of fetid breath from deep within. 

Essence flows around you, and a voice echoes at the edge of hearing.
"Trespasser!" bellows the monstrosity from one of its numerous mouths.
"Are you here to save us?" screeches another face.
"You sleep without dreaming," a third voice says, little more than a whisper.
"You have to help! We're trapped in here!"
"You have seen what cannot be unseen!"
"Release us!"
"Tell me what it is you want."
"Stop shouting nonsense and actually talk to me!"
[Attack] "Enough of this nonsense!"
"Dream forever, sleeper!"
"The horrors of Engwith truly know no bounds."
"Well, it sure don't look friendly."
"Just tell me which face to aim at, captain." Maia swallows as her focus shifts from one haunted expression to another.
"These poor souls. Killing them would be a mercy."
"Woedica's ashy hole, cap... Mayhaps we aught to be putting the poor bastards out of their misery?"
"Captain, that voice! We should never have come here!" Tekēhu claps his hands over his ears and squeezes his eyes hut.
"I say we guide them to the light."
"I sense neither a single consciousness nor a multitude. More like a fog of... midges."
"Don't antagonize it, Fassina."
"I expected to find the jailer of this sorry institute, but it seems we've only found another prisoner."
"Does it speak sense to you?" Rekke curls his lip in disgust.
"Let us walk away and leave it be. You don't think it'll follow us, do you?"
"You tread where none should see!"
"Please, please! Just - if you - just give us back our..."
"There is no salvation. Only plaintive cries attend this charnel pit."
The hideous creature towers before you. Its limbs - little more than intertwined strips of muscular tendrils - wriggle and pulse as the dozen faces shifting across its flesh gape and yawp.
"You must be here to save us!"
"See without seeing. Seen."
"Stay back!"
"What can I do to help you?"
"As long as you're all agreed on what I should do..."
[Shift your hand towards your weapons.]
[Clench your fists.]
"Silence! Or be silenced!"
"We see back. See you. See beneath you."
"Sure, I was just leaving."
"I'm trying! Why don't you understand?!"
"Casità, we have heard this abomination before." Fassina covers one ear and winces.
"It is the voice of the Collections. The very mouth of madness."

With sudden clarity you see a vast orifice blooming open, blood-slick tendrils unfurling from its depths. Stairs rise from within Wael's titanic body, called by a specific memory pulsing within - sacrificed to - a machine set among shelves of innumerable books.

The vision fades, leaving you shaken. It was a key, you think, that now resides within your psyche. If you found this device - this Trephine - you believe you could activate it. But you know not what memory will open the way into the depths. That was claimed by Fyonlecg.
The vision fades, leaving you shaken. You now know exactly how to operate the Trephine in the Scriptorium - the very memory that it requires.
"The screams have ended, but the ringing in my ear remains."
"Reminds me of a wedding I went to once."
"What foul magic creates a creature like that?"
"Finally, some peace of mind."

"Another abominable tool of the gods destroyed. This was well done, Watcher."

She wipes gore from her blade.
"That foul soul rot be more cleared up now than not."
"That's what I was gonna say."
"What of its memories, the people trapped in that accursed shell?"
"You did a good thing, Watcher. Doesn't make up for the bad thing this place did to them, but... still."
"Why would God let this happen?"
"Let? The gods made this happen, child."
"We're done then? We can leave, ja?"
"Truly? That's the titan's key? That's, it's preposterous!"
Within the flow of souls you find the gemlike sparkle of something precious, something core to the creature - or to something consumed by the creature. It slips into you.
"We have what we need."
"That wizard mentioned Maura's name. Let's keep looking for her."
"Anybody else ready to leave this foul pit behind us?"
[Shake it off.] "Seen worse."
[Whistle quietly.] "Wow."
Your voice echoes in the darkness.
"I'm from [Player Culture], right? I... I think I am."
Your head swims, your vision blurs, and your thoughts slip from your grasp.
Your vision blurs slightly, but with a shake of your head you throw off the weight of the creature's words.
